alert.note: Alert for Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 10:04PM EDT until May 08 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maryland... Monocacy River near Frederick affecting Frederick County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in West Virginia... Opequon Creek near Martinsburg affecting Jefferson and Berkeley Counties. Cacapon River near Great Cacapon affecting Morgan County. For the Opequon Creek...including Martinsburg...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Monocacy River...including Frederick...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cacapon River...including Great Cacapon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cacapon River near Great Cacapon. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to late Sunday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 5.2 feet, or 3.8 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 10.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 06/04/1960. - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information. && River Name Fld Observed Sat Sat Sat Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 2AM 8AM 2PM Stg Time Date Cacapon River Great Cacapon 9.0 5.2 Fri 9 pm 5.6 7.1 8.7 10.0 2am Sun &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1015 AM EDT.
